item.title: My $850 smartwatch can’t render Korean text
item.author: zah@andrewzah.com (Andrew Zah)
item.description: I recently acquired a Garmin Fenix 6X, currently Garmin’s flagship model. While I did research beforehand, I forgot that my phone was in Korean, and thus the notifications would be in Korean… Silly me.

item.title: Hosting Minecraft Servers + BungeeCord with FreeNAS
item.author: zah@andrewzah.com (Andrew Zah)
item.description: How I set up multiple minecraft servers in FreeNAS with a bungeecord/waterfall proxy. This guide assumes you’re running a FreeNAS server on a local network.

item.title: My setup for remote programming on OSX in 2019
item.author: zah@andrewzah.com (Andrew Zah)
item.description: Hi! My name is Andrew, and I work remotely as a software developer. I’ve worked while traveling across America with spotty or no internet connection.

item.title: Living out of 2 backpacks: A 6-month retrospective
item.author: zah@andrewzah.com (Andrew Zah)
item.description: Table of Contents My Philosophy Life Abroad Socializing Food Work Housing Clothes Transportation The Bad Bag Review Goruck GR1 26L, GR2 40L OPPOSETHIS Invisible Rolltop The Items Things I ended up not using Things I didn’t use as much as I’d like Clothing Additions Item additions My Routine EDC (Every day carry) Sometimes carried items General Tips Conclusion In January of this year, I set out for semi-permanent traveling with only two* backpacks: A Goruck GR1 26L, and a Goruck GR2 40L.

item.title: Automatically deploy your blog via Git with Caddy and Docker
item.author: zah@andrewzah.com (Andrew Zah)
item.description: Over the years, I’ve incrementally optimized my blog. I used to use an entire rails setup with postgres, because that was the first thing I learned… Yet that’s quite the overkill for a blog with static content.

item.description: I was inspired to write this after reading German for Programmers.\{\{cite(n=0)}} It’s quite likely that I’m just biased to see things a certain way because I work with programming languages for a living, but I often find myself drawing comparisons among Korean and programming.

item.title: A new year, a new site

item.description: I’ve migrated my website. Again. This time, I decided to implement it using Gutenberg, a static website generator which is written in Rust.
